etymologies: mid 19th century: from modern Latin Bromelia (named by Linnaeus after Olaf Bromel (1639–1705), Swedish botanist) + -ad

definitions: a plant native to tropical and subtropical America, typically having short stems with rosettes of stiff, usually spiny, leaves. Some kinds are epiphytic, and many are cultivated as houseplants.

notes.text: Family Bromeliaceae: Bromelia and other genera, and numerous species, including the pineapple and Spanish moss

shortDefinitions: plant of tropical and subtropical America
